programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton uncover glass blowing tools, autographed baseballs and a hockey puck launcher when sorting through a unit they did not want.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A hunter goes after a cannibal gator, while a team continues pursuing an animal that has eluded the swampers for years.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The work of a rescue team in Canada. Jamie realises he cannot do it all alone in Hope and hires a new driver, who ends up needing rescuing after he crashes Bruce's legendary truck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes across a famous Picasso etching, a rare REO Flying Cloud hot rod and a man trying to sell two gold-plated pairs of miniature trousers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Clients bring in a chair from the US Senate floor, a photo from the 1960s of a rocket being launched, and a driving suit belonging to Nascar racer Ryan Newman.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The story of two researchers who launch an investigation into the supposed UFO crash in Shag Harbour, Nova Scotia on October 4, 1967. Locals claim to have seen and heard the craft hovering above the surface before falling into the waters off the shoreline. While the Navy, coast guard and police were all dispatched, the government claims there was no trace of anything suspicious.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: UFO sightings throughout the world during the highly active period of the 1970s. The sightings spread across locations from Kansas to New Zealand.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths return to the Middle Ages when they are tasked with forging a Crusader's Dagger from a thick rod of steel. The final two smiths that survive a daunting round of tests return to their home forges to create a weapon that helped steal from the rich and give to the poor - Robin Hood's Steel Takedown Bow.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Ursula closes up her store as she looks forward to a peaceful auction. Meanwhile, Bogart sets his sights on goji juice at an auction in Milton.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Paul is on the lookout for a gift at an auction in Mississauga. Meanwhile, Roy plans to employ some dirty tactics.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare retro motor in a West Virginia museum, and takes a fancy to an electronic peacock.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle go treasure hunting in Virginia, in search of bargains to stock their new shop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Richard Harrison and Rick examine an American Civil War bugle, and meet a former prime minister's grandson who brings a clock presented to his grandfather by former US president Richard Nixon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a flag from one of Nasa's last missions to the moon, signed by the Apollo 16 crew, before viewing a set of NFL pins.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the chance to buy the suit of KFC founder Colonel Sanders and a vintage punching-bag game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a collection of Sammy Davis Jr's personal tapes, and a pair of 1950s Schwinn Phantom bicycles.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers discover a collection of personal letters by Kennedy brothers John, Bobby and Teddy, and vintage Mickey Mouse telephones.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers land the chance to buy a hand grenade made for a Second World War espionage initiative by the Americans, and a 1950s peep-show machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers celebrate the discovery of a rare, unopened bottle of 1921 Dom Perignon, and uncover a collection of Freddy Krueger dolls from A Nightmare on Elm Street.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers find an antique professional gambler's kit and ponder a 1950s radiation detector and 19th-century currency.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is shocked to come across a shrunken human head from the jungles of the Amazon, and also finds a 1969 Buick Skylark and an American Civil War field desk.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team evaluates a hat worn by movie legend John Wayne, while a woman arrives hoping to sell her 1950s clapping chimp toy.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: In Wexford, the guys visit visit The Sky and the Ground pub, where hoarder landlord Johnny Baron's wife Nuala thinks it is time for a clearout of her husband's cluttered attic.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Through history, mankind has credited its existence to otherworldly beings. This programme contemplates whether any proof can be found in these early beliefs.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut theorists examine the creation myth of the 'Cosmic Egg', and look at why the concept is so pervasive throughout the world.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle investigates the 1909 shipwreck of RMS Republic, 50 miles off the coast of Nantucket, and attempts to prove the existence of her $1billion bounty.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: A mysterious knight arrives at Chartres Temple with devastating news. Louis struggles to produce an heir, creating a rift between he and his wife. King Philip sends Gawain on a mission, where he comes face to face with his former Templar brothers. Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney star.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Chase fails to show up for his second day as captain, and Dwaine struggles to live up to his dad's expectations.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Football's 47 Best Worst Songs
programme.desc: A rundown of the best and worst football songs ever released, featuring interviews with Gary Lineker, Adrian Chiles, Chris Waddle, David Baddiel, Keith Allen, Jim Rosenthal, John Barnes and many more. Presented by Bob Mortimer, who performed Middlesbrough's 1997 FA Cup Final song Let's Dance.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him to the River Tarn, where he joins a local angler to fish for pike. He also rustles up a popular confit of duck with braised red cabbage, and meets a chef in Moissac whose dishes are a celebration of seasonal specialities.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge journey through south-west France, sampling the famous sausages as he reaches Toulouse and creating the country's most popular ready-meal cassoulet further downstream.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a fleet of amazing concept cars, some so unique they do not know how to price them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a huge 200,000-square-foot factory-turned-private collection by Woody, its dumpster diving owner.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori take one of the biggest gambles of their lives on a mystery unit.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders head to Marina del Rey, California, in search of nautical equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott goes all out to win at an auction, while Lori and Chrissy clash.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright makes a shocking revelation, while a group of new bidders comes to town.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedians Lucy Porter and Romesh Ranganathan and TV judge Robert Rinder to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedians Richard Ayoade and Alun Cochrane to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who laugh out loud when reading a book, half-and-half scarves - and fun.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and actor Rob Delaney, presenter Davina McCall and actor and musician Laurence Fox to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who order starters, 12-string guitars and cyclists wearing Lycra.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee gets jealous when Lucy talks about her first love, so Daisy helps him turn the tables by setting him up with her gorgeous friend. However, he is surprised when things start moving very quickly between them. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Bobin (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

credits.actor: Joanna Bobin (Secret Diary of a Call Girl)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy's first love reappears on the scene and asks her to star in a play he has written especially for her. But Lee refuses to take it lying down and decides to fight for his flatmate's attention. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with a guest appearance by Simon Farnaby (Horrible Histories).

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy has her god-daughter dumped on her overnight, which wouldn't be so bad except the girl's stay coincides with her birthday - leaving the inexperienced guardian and her flatmate Lee struggling to come up with appropriate entertainment for a bunch of excited nine-year-olds. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with a guest appearance by Paul Kaye (Game of Thrones).

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Zoe Lyons, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. Recorded in September 2016.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Grime artist and self-taught chef Big Zuu takes his food truck to Croydon to meet with Jimmy Carr and cook his ultimate meal ready for when he steps off stage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Sara Pascoe and John Robins join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the events of October 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories, conspiracies and facts relating to Rudolf Hess's dramatic flight to Scotland in 1941 and his subsequent death in Spandau prison.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Aretha Franklin, Bill Withers, Rose Royce, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Free, Deep Purple, Jethro Tull, Yes and Dr Feelgood.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: A collection of studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring the Carpenters, Wings, Abba and Kate Bush.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Selection of archive performances from the decade, including music by singer-songwriters including Carole King, James Taylor, Neil Young, Randy Newman and Don McLean.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh, in his capacity as Ranger of the Great Park, takes a tour of Windsor's grounds and points out the modifications he has made during his tenure, including a deer park and a farm shop selling local produce. He then competes in the Royal Horse Show, which also features Prince Harry. Meanwhile, the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall host a special banquet for the Prince's Trust.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn goes behind the scenes at London's King's Cross station and finds out about the disused funicular railway hidden in the Avon Gorge in Bristol, blasted out of the cliff.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate when the lifeless body of Gemma, a 17-year-old estate agent, is found in an empty house. Delving into the girl's family history, the forensic pathologist discovers she was thrown out of her home by her mother for having a child at the age of 13. Claims that Gemma was having an affair with her mother's second husband further complicates Sam's inquiries. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An operation to detain an aggressive and armed senile pensioner goes horribly wrong and Amanda Prosser makes Gina the scapegoat, forcing the Borough Commander to suspend her from duty while her drink problem is assessed. Detectives Nixon and Nadir get a lead on big-time gangster Pete Larson, but Dale Smith can't resist playing with fire by wooing the villain's lonely wife.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch members realise life must go on following Hallam's death when Nick tells them a new sub-officer has been appointed.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's prank calls to the other cab firm have gone too far this time. Arthur sets up meeting to get Ron his stall back and poor Geta thinks Sanjay's up to no good.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A patient's deathbed murder confession presents Dr Finlay with a crisis of conscience, over whether to keep a secret entrusted to him in strictest confidence or see to it that justice is done.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron and Dr Finlay are given a frosty reception when called in to investigate an outbreak of unusual symptoms among the nuns of a convent in the Tannochbrae area. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plots revenge, while Lovejoy and Lady Jane bicker over a royal dinner service belonging to a Belgian countess. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads move into a grim little hut on the Chocanaw reservation and set about rebuilding the bridge, but Barry begins to go off the rails as he remembers the good times with Tatiana. Work goes well thanks to help from Joe's son Chip - but Granger is livid to discover he has been made a fool of, and vows to have his revenge. Tim Healy and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A British detective turns up looking for Moxey, and a vengeful Grainger tries to prevent the lads completing their reconstruction of the bridge - but Oz lures the upper-crust crook to America, where he finally gets his comeuppance. Drama, starring Tim Healy, Timothy Spall, Kevin Whately, Christopher Fairbank and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The boss of Brokenwood agricultural show dies after a ride on the Ghost Train, and the investigation reveals his suspected heart attack was something far more sinister.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part Two
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy and Brackenreid goes after the corrupt copper.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Alex investigates a burglary and assault at the home of her future in-laws - a case that brings her face to face with 14-year-old Peter Drake, who will grow up to be her husband and Molly's father. Gene's initial lack of interest in the case ends when the fingerprints of a supposedly dead gangster are found at the scene, and he seizes the opportunity to get more positive headlines for the Met.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A murder victim is discovered in a canal, and Gene soon has his prime suspect when it turns out the dead man was mixed up with loan shark Trevor Riley. In their search for incriminating evidence, Gene and the team resort to breaking into Riley's office after hours - but what they find takes the case in a completely different direction. Guest starring Tom Georgeson and Daisy Haggard.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: James returns to his home town of Bolton to defend a couple living in a run-down flat who have been accused of murdering their baby daughter. However, conflicting testimony soon brings him up against his learned friend, Head of Chambers Peter Foxcott. Starring John Thaw, Oliver Ford Davies and Haydn Gwynne.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo continue to investigate one of the biggest and darkest cases they have ever faced. In the second edition, Rachel's safety is thrown into question when the killers change the rules of their sick game. Meanwhile, as a police officer, Janet is rendered powerless to protect her daughter, but she knows she must try to find a way to stop the madness. The crime drama returns for a fifth series, this time featuring a single crime throughout three parts. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Far Out There
programme.desc: The team members think that they are facing a new Sykronian weapon when a vortex appears in the sky over Enchanted Island.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: As Fizz gets ready to travel to another dimension populated entirely by other Fizzes, Magoo turns up and thinks that Weasel has a new kitten..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for billionaire Bruce Payne, aka the superhero, Ratman. When Ratman is kidnapped, Magoo decides to save the day..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tends to Fizz's toothache, but Magoo turns up, thinking he's busting into an animal testing lab..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike's over the moon! He's going to spend the afternoon with the neighbor's dog. Except that it's not Iris, it's Ginette.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike recreates a fun fair on the patio as a great way to impress Iris. He decorates the terrace and invites her over.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean's landlady orders him to get rid of a mole making a mess of her exquisitely manicured croquet lawn.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero is kept awake by the deafening sound of roadworks outside his bedroom window, but a plot to restore peace by feeding the workmen goes spectacularly wrong.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben hops into the Rustbuggy for a driving lesson along the sand dunes of Cape Cod.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Jarring Jerkiness of the Judge J.O.R.T.S.
programme.desc: The boys' jorts-wearing Spanish teacher is inspired by Harold and George to become a superhero..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave's first plane journey doesn't go to plan when the air pressure and the need to go to the toilet makes his head swell..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef presents more highlights from the series, including recipes from Thomasina Miers, Nisha Katona and Jonathan Phang, and a meal prepared for actor Larry Lamb.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: On the next leg of his Islands to Highlands tour, James travels to Devon where he meets his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. While they are in the area, James visits a mushroom farm, and Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to prepare an extravagant cheese platter.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head for rural Cornwall, where they create a spectacular contemporary garden for Chris Finney, a former serviceman who was awarded the George Cross in 2003. A space age-inspired area - complete with solar dome - will test Chris's knowledge as a novice gardener, and provide a stimulating haven for his young family.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Wolverhampton, where Aidan Pass meets his match over a football cap, and Tony Geering pays over the odds for an item.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five dentistry students answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Cameroon v England. Gabriel Clarke introduces highlights of the thrilling 1990 World Cup quarter-final from Stadio San Paolo in Naples, Italy. With original coverage hosted by Nick Owen and Elton Welsby and pre-match analysis from Bobby Moore and Jimmy Greaves.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara present the second part of the semi-final, with the best competitors from four heats testing their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Glasgow to take part in a series of unusual challenges, with a prize of 1,000 up for grabs.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, however, they have all used up their Golden Buzzers already - each granting a place in the live semi-finals to their chosen acts.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes each week, he challenges presenter Stacey Solomon, comedian Joel Dommett and Coronation Street's Beverley Callard to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)
programme.desc: James Bond joins forces with a Chinese agent to foil a media mogul's scheme to start a war between their countries - a case complicated by the fact that an old flame is now married to his new enemy. Using an undetectable stealth ship, the press baron plans to launch an undetectable sneak attack on both nations' navies, knowing they will blame each other - giving him exclusive global media coverage of the resulting conflict. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, Teri Hatcher and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads for Turin to buy a Fiat 500, but the only way to get it back to the UK is to drive it, and the engine is in need of urgent attention.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce travels from Plymouth to Illinois by buying and selling various German hardware, while his mate Kevin purchases the last remaining German torpedo boat for five million pounds.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey and Paul Sr agree to meet but fail to reach consensus on the conditions they will meet under, while OCC builds a bike memorialising the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A machine with 588 sharp teeth helps keep the coldest airport in America running. Plus, mighty tugboats chew through ice chunks in Alaska.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes to the waters of Alaska aboard a fish-processing ship, where he is faced with the challenge of bleeding and gutting the day's catch.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the creation of commonplace items such as digital paintings and badminton rackets are detailed.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The development of car manufacturing processes, beginning with how a Morgan Aero Coupe is made.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: We Have Not Yet Begun to Fight
programme.desc: Polar ice descends and each Skipper must choose flight or fight. The Saga is in danger of sinking and Jake needs to act quickly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a Ferrari 308 GT4 within his budget, and when he secures one hopes that Edd China is up to the task of restoring it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer buys a 1974 Ferrari Dino, but has to wait for Edd China to restore it before he can sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers Revisited
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer track down the owner of the Alfa Romeo Spider they worked on in a previous series, and discover the vehicle has a new dent.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Maserati 3200 GT for under 10,000, but he suspects it is going to cost a lot of money to complete a successful makeover as problems include wayward handling, a hair-trigger throttle and a faulty air-conditioning system.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China try to make a profit on their first electric project as they restore a 1985 Maserati Bi-Turbo that was converted to electric in the early 1990s.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer enlists mechanic Edd China's help to restore an AMC Pacer. However, a strict budget means their ideas for the 1970s hatchback will need to be credible as well as costed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team wants to tackle an eco-friendly build, and Mike makes it happen when he picks up an original Econobox, a 1977 Honda CVCC, in need of a rebuilt engine.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australia's inhospitable Outback terrain. Crop-dusting ace Dennis faces extreme low-level flying in a race to complete the biggest job of the year, while Trevor and his rookie aviators prepare to save tourists in a fierce storm.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant work on a 1969 Opel GT, which suffers fresh body damage, a backfiring engine, shoddy brakes, and faulty headlights.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a huge barn in Sussex, modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard discovers a large collection of animal-themed curiosities and objects. Then in Cardiff, his favourite kind of antiques are finally revealed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a clock made from the propeller of a First World War plane, a pair of stained glass windows, and an ancient shoe-stretching machine.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part one of two. Setting out from John O'Groats, the first part of Henry Cole's ride takes in the history, the landscapes and probably the rain of Scotland. He meets the odd laird and revels in the quietest roads in the UK.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: George returns home to fight a lawsuit, leaving Scott with sole responsibility for doubling gold production on the pair's claim.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a variety of unlikely objects, including beer bottles and insects, proved to be sources of vital evidence in murder investigations.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Michelle Thornton, who disappeared on December 30, 2010. Footage from surveillance cameras in her building, plus fingerprints and DNA evidence led police to known felon Gary Wade.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually her kiiller was caught.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The IRS analyses a number of unusual clues that help locate the kidnapper of a wealthy businessman's wife, who was abducted in 1988.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators are called in when a drugs raid also uncovers roosters kept for fighting, while Dana Moss rescues two dogs on the verge of giving birth.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr. Peter performs risky surgery on a guinea pig. Plus, a German Shepherd is rushed into the clinic with suspected paralysis from a tick and a snake needs specialist help. S1/5/10

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.sub-title: Top 10 Men in a Bride's World
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli counts down the top 10 men in a bride's world, from a father crying tears of joy and a brother vetoing all low-cut options, to an opinionated fashionista friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli looks back at larger-than-life brides, the outlandish dresses they requested and how the salon dealt with their over-the-top demands.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Kelly inherited her love of food from her obese mother. After a personal tragedy her weight ballooned to over 700 pounds, placing her on the verge of immobility.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 700lbs, Teretha's life is confined to a bed. Her family fears losing her and hopes a gastric bypass will provide the solution she needs to save her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who weighs 700 pounds is completely dependent on her husband and lives in constant fear that she will die, so tries to change her diet prior to gastric surgery.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Liz and John Calvert, who vanished in March 2008 from Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, where they ran a boating resort business. Shortly before they went missing some financial discrepancies were found in their bank accounts, and suspicion fell on their accountant Dennis Gerwing - who committed suicide a day after being named a person of interest in relation to their disappearance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nikasha wants to look like a grown woman on her wedding day, but her father would like her to appear the way she did on her sixteenth birthday.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Cindy and her mother hope to find a big, regal ball gown, and are surprised when her sister and best friend fly in from Miami.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice is worried her custom-made gown may not be all she had hoped for, while money is no object for Aleshia as she seeks the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing seven stone, Stephanie wants to show off her new figure in a sexy wedding dress, while Akisha worries her outfit will not impress her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: If You've Got It, Flaunt It
programme.desc: Embracing her height, pro-basketball player Kia looks for a long dress to complement her six-inch heels.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Aspiring country music star Whitney Duncan wants a romantic lace gown that gives her some curves, while a bride with a larger-than-life personality looks for a dress to match.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having tried on 100 gowns, Lisa is still looking for her ideal outfit, while Brittany is determined to wear pink on her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: With Alaska coming up short, Liz has flown 4,000 miles to find a dress, while Amanda has exhausted all options in Europe and has high hopes for the salon.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa is tired of hearing her family complain about her cooking, and aims to prove that she can do more than just order takeaways. But spirits interfere when she attends a class.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo's friend reveals her son can also see spirits and asks for her help. However, when she meets him it results in an unexpected revelation.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo urges Victoria to earn her keep around the house, then turns her attention to a client struggling to cope with a death in the family.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo meets one of her biggest detractors, and as Valentine's Day approaches, Larry plans a last-minute romantic night.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A man tries to pretend his hoarding and impulsive shopping is a hobby - but it becomes clear that his obsession is on the verge of ruining both his home and his family.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The suspected abduction of a 14-year-old girl. Hope had earlier sought solace online following her parents' divorce. When she vanished, the case was initially treated as a runaway incident, but her family later received a call suggesting Hope didn't leave by choice.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: The case of the so-called 'bathtub killer', a serial rapist-killer who terrorised the Dallas-Fort Worth area in the 1990s.

programme.title: Serial Psyche
programme.desc: Experts and investigators explore the crimes and backgrounds of serial killers who work in pairs. They look into the psychology of Fred and Rosemary West and others..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How crime writers research their material, combining the perspectives of police, criminals and journalists to provide detailed accounts of illegal activity.
